title: Romantic password-protected digital love surprise gift website with multi-step creator flow and shareable private links

requirements.text: Implement backend persistence for user-created “gift pages” in a single Motoko actor, including creation, retrieval, and password validation based on a special date in DDMMYYYY format, and returning only the minimum data needed to render the gift page.

quotes: The website must start with a password-protected entry screen where the password is a special date (DDMMYYYY format).
Step 6: Generate a unique private shareable link
– No pre-filled demo content – All content must be user-generated

acceptanceCriteria: A gift page record can be created with: partner name, sender name, email, special date (DDMMYYYY), banner image reference, multiple photos (each with its own note), love message, ending message, quiz items, and hidden/surprise messages.
Backend returns a unique, non-guessable gift identifier suitable for use in a shareable link (e.g., a random ID, not an incrementing counter).
Backend provides a method to verify a submitted password (DDMMYYYY) for a given giftId; gift content is not returned unless the password is correct.
Backend provides a method to fetch gift content for rendering after successful password verification (can be combined with verification).
No demo/sample/default content is stored or returned by the backend for any new gift.

requirements.text: Create a multi-step, mobile-first “Gift Creator” flow in the frontend that collects all user-generated content with smooth transitions between steps: (1) partner name, sender name, email, special date (DDMMYYYY), (2) upload banner image + upload multiple photos and enter a personal note for each photo, (3) write the love message, (4) write the ending message, (5) live preview of the final gift page, (6) generate a unique private shareable link.

quotes: Creation flow: – Multi-step form to create the gift – Step 1: Partner name, sender name, email, special date (used as password) – Step 2: Upload banner image and multiple photos (with note input for each photo) – Step 3: Write love message – Step 4: Write website ending message – Step 5: Live preview of the final gift page – Step 6: Generate a unique private shareable link
– Smooth transitions between steps
– No pre-filled demo content – All content must be user-generated

acceptanceCriteria: All form steps are accessible in a clear stepper-like flow and animate smoothly between steps (fade/slide).
Special date input is validated client-side to exactly 8 digits (DDMMYYYY) and shows an English validation error if invalid.
Banner image upload accepts an image file and shows a preview.
Multiple photo uploads are supported; each uploaded photo remains a separate item with its own note input bound to that specific photo.
Live preview renders using only the content the user has entered; if a field is empty, it is simply absent/blank (no placeholder romance text or demo imagery).
Final step calls the backend to create the gift and returns a shareable link that the user can copy.

requirements.text: Store uploaded images in the frontend as user-provided assets (no demo images) and ensure fast loading by generating and using appropriately sized previews/thumbnails for the gallery while keeping originals available for high-quality viewing.

quotes: Photo gallery section with multiple uploaded images
– Fast loading

acceptanceCriteria: Gallery displays optimized thumbnails/previews (generated client-side) to keep initial load fast.
Clicking a photo uses an available higher-quality source (original or larger preview) without blocking the entire page render.
No stock/demo images appear anywhere unless the creator uploads them.

requirements.text: Implement the shareable gift experience route in the frontend (e.g., /gift/:giftId) that starts with a password entry screen; on correct password, transition smoothly into the main gift page with soft romantic animations; on incorrect password, show a clear English error and allow retry.

quotes: The website must start with a password-protected entry screen where the password is a special date (DDMMYYYY format). After correct password, smoothly open the main page with soft romantic animation.
Step 6: Generate a unique private shareable link

acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the shareable link shows a password entry screen first (gift content is not visible behind it).
Password must be entered in DDMMYYYY format; incorrect attempts show an error message and do not reveal gift data.
After successful entry, the app transitions into the gift page with a smooth fade/slide/romantic animation sequence.
Refreshing the page returns to the password entry screen unless the user re-enters the password (no password stored in URL).

requirements.text: Build the main gift page sections and interactions using the creator’s content: hero banner with animated “For [Partner Name]” and “From [Sender Name]” text, flip-photo gallery (3D flip on click, back shows note), love letter section with typing or fade-in animation, memory/quiz section with creator-defined relationship questions, surprise/hidden messages that reveal on click, final romantic message section with floating hearts animation, and an ending last-screen message with soft fade-out and floating hearts.

quotes: Main website sections: Hero section... Photo gallery... flips with a smooth 3D animation... Love letter section... Memory / quiz section... Surprise notes or hidden messages... Final romantic message section with hearts animation... Website ending section... last screen with soft fade-out animation and floating hearts

acceptanceCriteria: Hero section displays the uploaded banner image and animates the “For [Partner Name]” and “From [Sender Name]” text in a romantic, premium style.
Photo gallery shows each uploaded photo as its own card; clicking/tapping triggers a smooth 3D flip animation; the back side shows that photo’s personal note.
Love letter section animates the long message (typing effect or staged fade-in) without layout jank on mobile.
Memory/quiz section renders creator-defined questions (and, if provided, answers) with a “reveal” interaction suitable for a surprise gift.
Surprise/hidden messages are hidden by default and reveal individually on click/tap.
Final section includes a floating hearts animation; ending message appears as the last screen with a soft fade-out transition and floating hearts overlay/background.

requirements.text: Add creator inputs for the “Memory / quiz” content and for “Surprise notes / hidden messages” as part of the creation flow, ensuring all displayed quiz questions and hidden messages are user-generated (no pre-filled questions).

quotes: Memory / quiz section with cute questions about the relationship
Surprise notes or hidden messages that reveal on click
– No pre-filled demo content – All content must be user-generated

acceptanceCriteria: Creator can add/edit/remove multiple quiz items (at minimum: question text; optionally: answer text).
Creator can add/edit/remove multiple hidden/surprise messages.
Gift preview and final gift page display exactly the creator-entered quiz items and hidden messages; none are pre-populated.

requirements.text: Apply a consistent, modern romantic visual theme across the entire app: soft pink/red/white palette, premium spacing, elegant cursive paired with a modern readable font, and smooth fade/slide/heart-float animations; ensure the UI is mobile-first responsive and uses modern UI components.

quotes: Design style: – Clean, premium, emotional, romantic – Soft pink, red, white color palette – Elegant cursive + modern fonts – Smooth fade, slide, heart-float animations – Mobile-first responsive design
Technical requirements: – Modern UI components

acceptanceCriteria: App uses a coherent romantic theme (colors, typography, component styling) consistently across creator flow, password entry, and gift page.
Animations are smooth on mobile and do not block interactions (e.g., reduced motion preference is respected if available).
Layouts adapt cleanly to small screens first, then scale up for tablet/desktop.
No blue/purple-dominant theme is introduced (palette remains pink/red/white as requested).

requirements.text: Make the frontend SEO-friendly and fast-loading within the constraints of a React SPA by setting appropriate document titles/descriptions for the creator flow and for gift pages (based on partner/sender names), and by minimizing unnecessary asset loading before password unlock.

quotes: – SEO friendly
– Fast loading

acceptanceCriteria: Creator flow has a sensible English document title (e.g., “Create Your Surprise Gift”).
Gift page sets an English document title that includes “For [Partner Name]” after unlock (or a neutral title before unlock).
Gift content/images are not eagerly rendered/downloaded at full size before successful password entry (to keep entry fast and reduce accidental exposure).

requirements.text: Generate and include required static romantic visual assets (used purely for visuals) in frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the UI (e.g., subtle background pattern, decorative hearts, favicon) without routing these assets through the backend.

quotes: Clean, premium, emotional, romantic
Smooth fade, slide, heart-float animations

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are added under frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend.
At least a subtle background texture/pattern and a small icon/mark are used to enhance the premium romantic look without adding demo “content.”
These assets do not contain any names/messages and are purely decorative visuals.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no multi-canister architecture).
Do not edit files under frontend immutablePaths; compose UI using existing components instead.
No external databases or third-party services (including email delivery) are used.
No pre-filled demo content: all names, messages, photos, quiz questions, and hidden messages shown on a gift page must come from creator input.
nonGoals: Sending emails to the provided email address.
Third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity would be allowed, but is not required by the request).
Real-time chat, push notifications, or social media integrations.
Using external image hosting/CDNs outside of what the app can store/provide itself.
